DataElement.preferredDefinition: A classification of a microbiology susceptibility result.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microbiology Susceptibility Domain Microbiology Susceptibility Result Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests._A classification of a microbiology susceptibility result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology susceptibility tests.

Property.preferredDefinition: A classification of a microbiology susceptibility result.

Concepts.definition: A classification of a microbiology susceptibility result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Testing Result Category Terminology Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the microorganism result category codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms may be inhibited when higher than normal dosages of an antimicrobial agent are used and maximal possible blood concentration of the antimicrobial agent is achieved.

Concepts.definition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms may be inhibited when higher than normal dosages of an antimicrobial agent are used and maximal possible blood concentration of the antimicrobial agent is achieved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection.

Concepts.definition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is not inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent with normal dosage, or microorganisms demonstrate minimum inhibitory concentrations (MIC) or zone diameters that fall in the range where specific microbial resistance mechanisms are likely in effect, or clinical efficacy of the agent against the microorganism has not been reliably shown in treatment studies.

Concepts.definition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is not inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent with normal dosage, or microorganisms demonstrate minimum inhibitory concentrations (MIC) or zone diameters that fall in the range where specific microbial resistance mechanisms are likely in effect, or clinical efficacy of the agent against the microorganism has not been reliably shown in treatment studies.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is not inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection. This category may be applied to new antimicrobial agents for which no resistant microorganisms have been encountered at the time the initial interpretive criteria are determined. Microorganisms that test with an MIC above or a zone measurement below the susceptible interpretive criteria may be designated as nonsusceptible. A designation of nonsusceptible does not necessarily mean that a resistance mechanism(s) exists in the microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms is not inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection. This category may be applied to new antimicrobial agents for which no resistant microorganisms have been encountered at the time the initial interpretive criteria are determined. Microorganisms that test with an MIC above or a zone measurement below the susceptible interpretive criteria may be designated as nonsusceptible. A designation of nonsusceptible does not necessarily mean that a resistance mechanism(s) exists in the microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms may be inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection. The response rates may be lower than for susceptible isolates.

Concepts.definition: A microbial susceptibility test result in which the growth of microorganisms may be inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection. The response rates may be lower than for susceptible isolates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The growth of the microorganism is intermediate or resistant to an antimicrobial. This category is used when describing isolates that are above the susceptible interpretive category breakpoint as defined by a standards organization, and, when the "intermediate" breakpoint and the "resistant" breakpoint are defined but not applied; or when "intermediate" and "resistant" interpretive categories are merged/combined.

Concepts.definition: The growth of the microorganism is intermediate or resistant to an antimicrobial. This category is used when describing isolates that are above the susceptible interpretive category breakpoint as defined by a standards organization, and, when the "intermediate" breakpoint and the "resistant" breakpoint are defined but not applied; or when "intermediate" and "resistant" interpretive categories are merged/combined.
